alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Eastern Lincoln County; Jemez Mountains; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; South Central Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southwest Chaves County; Southwest Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued April 02 at 3:15PM MDT until April 04 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 6 PM MDT MONDAY... ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM MONDAY TO 9 PM MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, southwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 55 mph expected. For the High Wind Warning, southwest winds 40 to 50 mph with gusts up to 75 mph expected. Gusts up to 80 mph likely in the south central mountains east through Lincoln County and into Chaves County. * WHERE...Portions of central, north central, northeast, southeast, and west central New Mexico. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, from 9 AM to 6 PM MDT Monday. For the High Wind Warning, from 6 PM Monday to 9 PM MDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. Power outages are possible. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Areas of blowing dust will restrict visibility.
info.instruction: Take action to secure trash cans, lawn furniture, and other loose or lightweight outdoor objects. Extremely hazardous driving conditions can be expected, especially for motorists in high profile vehicles who should consider delaying travel.
